text: ICA41.1. UDP Checksum Consider the following data 01010 11011 11101 00101 Compute the UDP checksum over this data (assuming the UDP checksum operates over 5 bit words instead of 16 bit words). (-} Will the UDP checksum ever be able to detect an error if two bits in the same column are flipped in opposite directions (one of them flipped from O to 1 and the other flipped from 1to 0)? No Yes Will the UDP checksum always be able to detect an error if two bits in the same column are flipped in the same direction (both of them flipped from O to 1 or both of them flipped from 1 to 0)? Yes No Will the UDP checksum always be able to detect an error if two bits in different columns are flipped (either from 0 to 1 or from 1 to 0)? No Yes Save & Grade Single attempt - Additional attempts available with new variants @
